lead_paragraph: MORRISSEY--Eileen Colligan, born February 5, 1921, NYC, died April 15, 2016, San Francisco, CA, daughter of the late Katherine (Riordan) and Patrick Colligan (NYPD), grew up in Greenwich Village's Irish-American community centered on St. Joseph's Church. Filled with optimism, grace and humor, she lived fully, engaged with ideas, family and friends and imbued with faith. Graduating high school at 16, she earned her BA at Manhattanville and LLB at Fordham (editor-in-chief, Law Review). She practiced in NYC, at Hawkins, Delafield & Wood and at Milbank, Tweed; in Washington, DC, at Paul, Weiss. She married John Carroll Morrissey, raised eight children and earned her LLM at Golden Gate University, San Francisco. Eileen's leadership benefited numerous charities and clubs, including St. Elizabeth's Infant Hospital Auxiliary and Holy Family Day Home. With fierce and loyal love, quick wit, hugs and help, she embraced her children, grandchildren and friends, and sustained 66 years of devoted, loving marriage with John. Survived by her husband; sister Kathleen Molloy of Larchmont, NY; her children, Jay Edward (Marilyn), Ellen Jenkins (James), Katherine, John (Colleen), Patricia, Richard (Anne), Brian, and Peter (Anne) Morrissey; nine grandchildren. Predeceased by her brother, Rev. Timothy Colligan. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MORRISSEY, EILEEN COLLIGAN
